alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, north central Knox and southwestern Clay Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sasser, or 8 miles southwest of Manchester, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Haven and Fount around 345 PM EDT. Cottongin, Woollum, Pigeonroost and Herron around 350 PM EDT. Jonsee, Park Valley, House, Hima, Sibert and Horse Creek Junction around 355 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bluehole, Ogle, Boho and Goose Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
